str2: But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
If. From ei and an; a conditional particle; in case that, provided, etc.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
From aggello; a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.
Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.

parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From eu and aggelos; to announce good news especially the gospel.
Gen: from; dat: beside, in the presence of; acc: alongside of.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 1st Person Plural
str2: From eu and aggelos; to announce good news especially the gospel.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
A votive offering, a thing devoted to God; a curse, the thing cursed. From anatithemai; a ban or excommunicated.
